articles.headline: The Construction Labor Shortage
articles.subTitle: It’s no secret that the world is rapidly urbanizing. Builders can’t keep up.

articles.headline: Construction Sees a Surge of 44,000 Jobs in January
articles.subTitle: Bureau of Labor Statistics: Industry’s jobless rates for the month were mixed.

articles.headline: The Best Jobs In Welding
articles.subTitle: The economic recession wasn't felt harder by any U.S. industry more than welding, where employment peaked in 2006 and plateaued in 2007, then bottomed out in 2011.

articles.headline: Where Are All the Welders?
articles.subTitle: Welding costs are climbing and production is lagging, in part because there aren't enough workers to go around.

articles.headline: The Healthcare Labor Shortage
articles.subTitle: It’s no secret that the world is rapidly urbanizing. Healthcare workers can’t keep up.

articles.headline: Healthcare Sees a Surge of 84,000 Jobs in March
articles.subTitle: Bureau of Labor Statistics: Industry’s jobless rates for the month were positive.
